name: Late-90s Captain America action figures
description: In 1996, Microsoft released its first competitive browser, which was complete with its own features and tags. It was also the first browser to support style sheets, which at the time was seen as an obscure authoring technique.

It was also the first browser to support style sheets, which at the time was seen as an obscure authoring technique. The\u00a0HTML markup\u00a0for\u00a0tables\u00a0was originally intended for displaying tabular data. However designers quickly realized the potential of using HTML tables for creating the complex, multi-column layouts that were otherwise not\u00a0possible.<\/p>\n<h2>A Subheading<\/h2>\n<p>At this time, as design and good aesthetics seemed to take precedence over good mark-up structure, and little attention was paid to semantics and\u00a0web accessibility. HTML sites were limited in their design options, even more so with earlier versions of HTML. To create complex designs, many web designers had to use complicated table structures or even use blank\u00a0spacer .GIF\u00a0images to stop empty table cells from collapsing. CSS\u00a0was introduced in December 1996 by the\u00a0W3C\u00a0to support presentation and layout. This allowed\u00a0HTML\u00a0code to be semantic rather than both semantic and presentational, and improved web accessibility, see\u00a0tableless web
